title: First picture of British firefighter who died during triathlon in Spain
text:

Moving tributes have been paid to a British firefighter who died during a triathlon in Spain.

Carl Cavanagh, 45, from Bournemouth, died on a beach in Majorca in the middle of the prestigious Peguera Challenge event on Saturday.

The fireman had to be pulled from the water after getting into difficulty during the 1.9 kilometre (1.2 mile) swim leg of the race.

He is believed to have gone into cardiac arrest on Tora beach.

(Image: SOLARPIX.COM)

Despite the efforts of medical responders, they were unable to save Mr Cavanagh.

His wife and parents reportedly witnessed his collapse and the near hour-long battle to save him.

A routine investigation led by a local judge is ongoing, with local reports saying he suffered 'symptoms of drowning'.

Yesterday morning heartbroken Lizzie Cavanagh said in an emotional outpouring on social media: “My heart is breaking Carl Cavanagh. Where are you? I need you to take my pain away, please.”

(Image: SOLARPIX.COM)

Adam Whitefield said of the former Heathrow Airport firefighter, thought to have been working as a crew commander at Bournemouth Airport: “RIP brother Carl Cavanagh. Thank you for everything. I will miss you forever. Until we meet again. Love you.”

Mark Beaudro added: “He has been an inspiration to many a new firefighter. My mentor in more ways than one. The cheekiest of chaps and loveable rogue. He definitely will be missed.”

A spokesman for Saturday’s event, which featured triathletes from countries including the UK, Germany, Brazil and Slovakia, said: “It is with deep regret that the organisers announce the death of a participant in the Challenge Peguera Mallorca 2019 triathlon event.

(Image: SOLARPIX.COM)

“The athlete has required medical attention during the swimming segment and has been treated urgently by the medical services of the event.

“Our condolences to all the family and people close to the athlete, whom we will continue to support.

“We are working closely with the security forces and local authorities to gather all the details about this event.

“All sporting events will be held, including this afternoon's awards ceremony, and out of respect for the family, celebration events are suspended.

(Image: SOLARPIX.COM)

“Out of respect for the family's privacy, for the time being, we will not make any further comments.”

Calvia Council, the local authority covering the area where Mr Cavanagh died, said in a statement it “deeply regretted the death of an athlete that occurred during the swimming segment of the Challenge Peguera Mallorca 2019 triathlon.”

The event consisted of a 1.9 kilometre (1.2 mile) swim followed by two laps of a 45 kilometre (28 miles) bicycle circuit and a 23 kilometre (14 mile) four lap run.

Friends responded to Carl’s wife outpouring of anguish by offering words of support.

One said: “I wish I could wave a wand and the pain would be taken away.

“I can’t imagine the heartbreak and pain you are in but the love from your children and family will keep you going.”

Another added: “Take strength in those around you and know that we all love you dearly. Your strength will come from deep inside, but will also come from all who love you, especially you amazing children.”
description: Carl Cavanagh, from Bournemouth, is thought to have drowned during the Peguera Challenge in Majorca, Spain
